reviewText: Tales From The Darkside still remains one of horror's finest anthology tv shows ever. Going on a strong 4 seasons, Tales From The Darkside ranged from straight horror to science fiction to even dark comedy. Season 4 was no different. With Tom Savini back to direct an episode to one of the most terrifying Halloween episodes ever made let's take a run through of the 20 final episodes.Disc 11.Beetles - A man ignores an egyptian curse which leads to a severe beetle problem 0_0. Good episode simple premise. Good opener. 3 out of 42.Mary, Mary - A lonely woman with mannequins as her only friends catches the eye of the guy next door. Good episode with a solid lead performance and truly bizarre final scene. 3.5 out of 43.The Spirit Photographer - An old guy creates a device to easily capture ghosts on film. Lesser episode and unmemorable. But entertaining in it's cliche way. Okay twist ending. 2.5 out of 44. The Moth - Debbie Harry (Blondie) stars as a woman who believes her soul will enter the body of a moth when she passes away. Interesting idea done well. Good performances help. Familiar ending though. 3 out of 4.5.No Strings - A mobster wants a master marionette artist to make a dead guy say exactly what he wants to hear. Okay episode only. A bit silly with an easy to predict but memorable finale. 2 out of 46. The Grave Robber - Two archeologists get trapped in a mummy's tomb fighting to stay alive! Way to comedy heavy but it's an amusing filler episode. See the mummy play cards 0_0Disc 27.The Yattering And Jack - Hellraiser's Clive Barker wrote this one! It's about a demon who tries to take over a man's life. But the guy don't believe in no demons. (Even though his Christmas turkey jumped atop the tree.... you'll see) Totally terrible. Clive Barker had a good idea but it's wasted on an awful presentation. Silly at best. 1.5 out of 4.8.Seymourlama - A dorky teenager finds out that he is the ruler of some nation much to his parents surprise. Another silly episode with little good to say. Okay enough for one watch and it has a fairly amusing twist. 1.5 out of 49.Sorry, Right Number - A woman gets bizarre calls that feel so familiar. Finally a classic episode! Based on a Stephen King story. This is just fantastic! Creepy and really well done. 4 out of 410. Payment Overdue - A rude bill collector is terrorized by a woman from beyond the grave. Perfect episode imo. Very Twilight Zone like with a mean spirited final twist. 4 out of 411. Love Hungry - You won't forget this one 0_0. An overweight woman gets a device in the mail promosing her to help her lose weight. Holy crap 0_o. Very bizarre episode that will stay with you. You may never look at eating the same way. 4 out of 4.12.The Deal - Ugh the streak of classics ends! This is about a man who gets screenplay ideas from Satan. Bad and devoid of anything interesting happening. With a forced ending. Bad. 1 out of 4.13. The Apprentice - This is much better TYVM! A woman works for a puritan museum and is sent back in time. Sounds awful but it's not. A great concept done well! 4 out of 4Disc 314.The Cutty Black Sow - Terrifying. A boy tries to protect his grandmas soul from the cutty black sow one dark halloween night. Just flat out scary and suspenseful. Shocker of an end. 0_0 4 out of 415.Do Not Open This Box - Twilight Zone like episode about an old couple who open a box they weren't supposed to. Oh and someone wants it back. A little predictable and not scary at all. But interesting and lots of fun! 3.5 out of 416.Family Reunion - Tom Savini returns to direct this one about a motner who with the help of a social worker try to get back her son who was kidnapped by his father. There's more to it of course! Hey it's Darkside remember? Creepy episode and one of the hands down best of the season imo. Tom Savini really brought great things to his episodes and always brought suspense. Well made. 4 out of 4.17.Going Native - An alien observes humans and wonders... "why so violent and mad" Slow paced episode and it suffers from following some of the best of the season. But good story with quite alot of meaning.Something different :) .  3 out of 418.Hush - A classic fan favorite. While babysitting a girl has to battle a machine that sucks the life out of everything. Outstanding. On par with the very best of the series. 4 out of 419.Barter - I Love Lucy parody *cringes* about a read headed houswife dealing with an alien. Silly episode but not quite as bad as it could have been. I just couldn't care less. 2 out of 420.Basher Malone - Final episode about a wrestler who battles a wrestler from hell. Hulk Hogan inspired I would think. It's really alot if fun even if I wish the show ended with something more dark. 3 out of 4The picture looks fine, it sounds fine too :)There ya go everyone! Season 4. Every season had it's down but they always had plenty more up's. Season 4 was no different. It's a must buy for fans.
summary: Tales From The Darkside -The Final Season

reviewText: I remember when this series came out, I was a pre-teen at the time and almost never miss an episode. This was one of the best series on T.V. in the 80's, it had it all, humor,mystery, and the scare factor. I recommend buying this series to anyone, especially those who never got to watch the series on TV, either they were too young or too busy 2 watch it back in the day. As for the DVD, I thought the episodes were clear,cut well, and the set up is great, either U can watch a few episodes or all at once.Thank You,Kris L. CocKayne

reviewText: For those of you who are in your late 20's and early 30's, you may remember watching this show as a kid, and enjoying the Horrific; yet slightly comedic episodes.  This is really one of the greatest TV Horror Shows, ever made. The opening music score, is one of the most chilling I have personally ever heard.  I think for everyone growing up in the 80's, they not only appreciated the originality of these shows, but also that chilling music!!!!  In todays world, we are plaqued with garbage TV shows.  It seems that just about everything that exits Hollywood, whether it be TV or Movie, is absolute GARBAGE!If you are a real admirer of 70's and 80's Horror Movies then " Tales from the Darkside " is an absolute must see.  The episodes include:1. Beetles(9/27/87)2. Mary, Mary (10/4/87) ** 1/23. The Spirit Photographer (10/11/87)4. The Moth (10/18/87) ***5. No Strings (10/25/87)6. The Grave Robber (11/1/87)7. The Yattering and Jack (11/8/87)8. Seymourlama (11/15/87)9. Sorry, Right Number (11/22/87) ***10. Payment Overdue (2/14/88)11. Love Hungry (2/21/88) ***12. The Deal (2/28/88)13. The Apprentice (5/1/88)14. The Cutty Black Sow (5/8/88) *****15. Do Not Open This Box (5/15/88) Directed by Jodie Foster16. Family Reunion (5/22/88) **** 1/217. Going Native (6/19/88) ***18. Hush (7/10/88) *****19. Barter (7/17/88)20. Basher Malone (7/23/88)All and All, I would be hard pressed not to give this 5 stars.  It delivers in every aspect of the words " Great Show ".  The shows have very interesting story lines, they have great guest stars in many of the episodes, and even the actors whom I've never heard of, deliver stellar performances!  This is a true classic of the 80's and it has my 5* approval!Just remember one thing...The Darkness is Waiting for us to enter, Waiting to Enter us.  So whatever you do!!!! TRY TO ENJOY THE DAYLIGHT!!!!
